name: talisman

attributes.attribute: draws good luck or the blessing of gods to the owner
wards off evil spirits and bad luck

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Symbolic objects known as talismans are often used interchangeably with amulets, even though the two terms are not necessarily distinct. These magical objects serve different purposes, where a talisman is believed to attract good fortune or divine blessings to its owner, while an amulet is meant to protect against malevolent spirits and misfortune.
